original_title: ‘Stay connected abroad with HUTCH’s unbeatable data roaming deals’
original_body_lines: HUTCH, one of Sri Lanka’s leading mobile network service providers, continues to strengthen its position as the preferred and most affordable choice for outbound data roaming services, with its extensive global coverage. Offering flexible plans, HUTCH data roaming caters to both short and long-duration travellers for leisure, business, pilgrimage, or education.

Travellers can now enjoy up to 10GB of data for just USD 5 with a weekly plan, or opt for a 30GB monthly plan for just USD 15. These plans are designed to provide absolute peace of mind, ensuring users have uninterrupted connectivity while staying within their budget. HUTCH Sri Lanka has partnered with top mobile networks around the globe to provide quality connectivity anywhere. Accordingly, these data roaming plans cover all key travel destinations and more.

Explaining further, Hamdhy Hassen – Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) at HUTCH Sri Lanka said, “Our goal has always been to deliver the best value to our customers. With our roaming plans, we ensure that travellers from all segments can stay connected at incredibly affordable rates. Whether for business or leisure, we want our customers to have peace of mind knowing that they can easily activate and manage their data plans without worrying about a bill shock. At HUTCH, we are committed to making 1st class global connectivity accessible to all Sri Lankans, conveniently.”

Through the HUTCH Selfcare app, customers can conveniently activate roaming plans and monitor their usage in real-time, giving them full control over their data consumption. This is complemented by 24/7 customer priority digital support channels, ensuring that any assistance needed, no matter where in the world, can be swiftly attended to.

These features, combined with the affordability of the plans, have cemented HUTCH as the trusted provider for outbound data roaming, with prices that are often lower than those offered by local providers at travel destinations.
